intro: Campylospermum lastellii, commonly known as the lastellii campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
